name: Toni Kazic
content: Toni Kazic Skip to navigation Skip to content email kazict@missouri.edu phone 573-882-1946 place 143A Naka Hall Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Biography Toni Kazic is an associate professor in electrical engineering and computer science at the University of Missouri. She is currently working on methods to infer the structure of complex networks using the disease lesion mimic mutants of maize as a model system. Her work has included the development of an architecture for community query, deposit, review and curation of information on biochemical reactions, and the analysis of extant reaction networks. Kazic is a Fellow of the American College of Medical Informatics and was an Invited Researcher to the Institute for New Generation Computer Technology. She served as a program director for the National Science Foundation in computational biology, and now consults for the National Institutes of Health and the National Science Foundation and is a member of several national and international scientific advisory bodies. Education PhD from the University of Pennsylvania BS from the University of Illinois Technical Focus Computational biology Maize genetics Network interference Website: maizelesions.org Google Scholar Technical Focus Computational biology Maize genetics Network interence
